description: An online fundraiser for a Minnesota woman who used a racial slur in a viral video has raised over $675K, with many donations linked to white supremacist views.
title: Fundraiser for woman who used racial slur against child draws racist comments of support

description: Immigrant rights advocates had challenged an agency decision to pause parole programs that have allowed Ukrainian, Afghan, Cuban, Haitian, Nicaraguan and Venezuelan migrants to enter the country.
title: U.S. appeals court rejects Trump bid to revoke 400,000 migrants’ legal status

description: This is a free newsletter for Diddy on Trial newsletter subscribers.
title: Who will decide Diddy's fate?

description: It's the first Monday in May, which means that the biggest stars across film, music, fashion and beyond are gathering at the Metropolitan Museum of Art in New York City to celebrate “Superfine: Tailoring Black Style.”
title: See the red carpet looks from the 2025 Met Gala

description: The Baltimore Ravens on Monday announced they were releasing kicker Justin Tucker, calling it a tough decision based on the team's current roster.
title: Ravens release kicker Justin Tucker after massage therapists accuse him of misconduct

description: Jon Voight submitted a “comprehensive plan” to President Donald Trump mapping out ways to boost domestic film and television production, the  actor’s manager said.
title: Jon Voight met with Trump before president proposed tariffs on foreign film productions

description: Republicans were dealt a major blow in their bid to expand their Senate majority on Monday, with Georgia Gov. Brian Kemp passing a run against the party’s top target for defeat, Democratic Sen. Jon Ossoff.
title: GOP dealt a blow in the battle for the Senate: From the Politics Desk

description: Just weeks after announcing a 100% withholding rate on new overpayments of benefits, the Social Security Administration has slashed the rate down to 50% for certain beneficiaries.
title: Social Security reduces benefit clawback from 100% to 50% for some; experts still warn of 'devastating' effects

description: The fan who fell from the stands onto the Pittsburgh Pirates' home field last week is improving at a hospital, his sister said Monday.
title: Fan who fell from stands at Pittsburgh Pirates game is improving, sister says

description: U.S. pharmacy chain Rite Aid on Monday filed for bankruptcy protection for the second time in as many years, according to a court filing.
title: Rite Aid files for second bankruptcy in two years

description: Air traffic controllers temporarily lost communication with aircraft flying in and out of Newark Liberty International Airport last week, an incident that has continued causing major delays at the travel hub.
title: Air traffic control at Newark Airport briefly lost communication with aircraft, kicking off travel chaos

description: In its heyday, Alcatraz Island housed more than 260 prisoners, with notorious gangsters such as Al Capone, George "Machine Gun" Kelly and James "Whitey" Bulger serving time on the rocky outpost.
title: Trump's call to reopen Alcatraz as a prison could be stymied by roadblocks

description: Shanshan Dong explains how field producing is more than directing and organizing a news shoot — it's about executing what's at the heart of a story.
title: A day in the life of an NBC News field producer

description: President Donald Trump’s administration has not publicly released any accounting of who funded the transition efforts after he won the 2024 election, blowing past the timeline in which previous administrations have disclosed transition donors, despite pledging last year to release the names.
title: Trump has not said who funded his presidential transition effort despite pledging to disclose donors

description: In July 1962, 20-year-old Audrey Backeberg went missing from Reedsburg, Wisconsin.
title: Wisconsin woman found alive after missing for 62 years, has 'no regrets' about disappearing

description: More than a dozen New Yorkers were questioned Monday about what they knew about the federal sex trafficking case against Sean “Diddy” Combs as jury selection got underway in a Manhattan courtroom.
title: Jury selection begins in Sean 'Diddy' Combs sex trafficking trial

description: Georgia Gov. Brian Kemp has decided not to run for Senate next year, dealing a blow to Republicans who viewed the two-term governor as a top recruit.
title: Georgia Gov. Brian Kemp passes on running for a key Democratic-held Senate seat

description: The 2025 Met Gala’s theme is “Superfine: Tailoring Black Style." The event, live streamed by Vogue, kicks off at around 5:30 p.m. ET.
title: Met Gala co-chaired by Colman Domingo, LeBron James and more

description: OpenAI has bowed to pressure from civic leaders and ex-employees, announcing in a blog post on Monday that its nonprofit would retain control of the company even as it restructures into a public benefit corporation.
title: OpenAI says nonprofit will retain control of company, bowing to outside pressure

description: Six strikes targeted Yemen’s Hodeidah port, the Houthi-affiliated Al Masirah TV reported on Monday, blaming the strikes on Israel and the United States.
title: Israel launches airstrikes on Yemen after Houthi rebels struck airport

description: President Donald Trump has two crypto-focused dinners on the calendar this month — one aimed at deep-pocketed political donors, the other at meme coin millionaires.
title: Trump set to raise millions from crypto and meme coin this month

description: Footwear giant Skechers has agreed to be acquired by private equity firm 3G Capital for $63 per share, ending its nearly three-decade run as a public company, the retailer announced Monday.
title: Skechers to be acquired by 3G Capital in take-private deal, shares soar 25%

description: WARREN, Mich. — Walking into General Motors’ global design headquarters is like taking a step back in time.
title: How GM is trying to revive Cadillac as the quintessential American luxury car brand

description: Trump’s Sunday proposal to impose tariffs on foreign films sparked confusion in Hollywood. By Monday, the White House clarified no final decision had been made.
title: Trump's Hollywood tariffs announcement is met with confusion and fear

description: At least three people were killed when a panga boat overturned off Torrey Pines State Beach near San Diego on Monday as the Coast Coast and sheriff's deputies launched a frantic search for more victims, authorities said.
title: At least 3 dead, multiple people missing after boat overturns near San Diego

description: The lawsuit claims that the Department of Health and Human Services is unable to carry out vital functions due to staffing cuts and closing 13 agencies.
title: 20 state attorneys general sue Trump administration to restore health agencies

description: An elderly female cat was found alive last week following a nearly 400-foot fall at a Utah national park that killed her owners, authorities said.
title: Cat survives nearly 400-foot fall at Utah national park that killed its 2 owners

description: An officer on Monday pleaded guilty to felony manslaughter in connection with the 2024 fatal beating of New York inmate Robert Brooks.
title: Officer pleads guilty to manslaughter in fatal beating of inmate Robert Brooks

description: U.S. crude oil futures fell more than 2% on Monday, after OPEC+ agreed to surge production for a second month.
title: U.S. crude oil prices fall after OPEC+ agrees to surge production in June

description: In rural Alabama, high school students are preparing for cybersecurity careers.
title: Cyberattacks are on the rise. These teens are training to defend against them.

description: Watch live coverage as President Trump delivers remarks at the White House where he is expected to announce that the 2027 NFL draft will be held in Washington, D.C., according to a person familiar with the plans.
title: Trump expected to announce D.C. will host 2027 NFL draft

description: At the “Choose Europe for Science” event in Paris, French President Emmanuel Macron offered researchers grants and new policy plans if they move to Europe.
title: Europe drives to attract scientists after Trump freezes US funding

description: Voters in U.S. Rep. Mike Lawler’s suburban New York swing district unloaded a barrage of criticism on him at a raucous town hall, questioning him about Trump’s aggressive agenda.
title: In New York, a GOP congressman is shelled with questions about Trump during raucous town hall

description: NBC Sports’ Mike Tirico stepped away from coverage of the Kentucky Derby on Saturday due to a nut allergy but says he’s doing well now.
title: Mike Tirico speaks out about Kentucky Derby exit after having allergic reaction

description: The meltdown at Newark Airport is rolling into a second week with hundreds of flights delayed or cancelled over the weekend, causing ripple effects across the country. Meanwhile, an investigation is underway after an Army Black Hawk helicopter appeared to deviate from its flightpath, forcing two passenger jets to abort their landings at Reagan National. NBC’s Tom Costello reports for TODAY.
title: Frustration grows over ripple effects of delays at Newark Airport

description: Donald Trump and NBC's "Meet the Press" moderator Kristen Welker discuss the economy, immigration and more.
title: Trump 'Meet the Press' interview and pope contender Luis Antonio Tagle: Morning Rundown

description: Pessimism runs high in the class of 2025 after entry-level hiring prospects have tightened for two years straight and a student debt crackdown begins.
title: New college grads face a tougher job market — again

description: Indigenous people across North America are calling this week for sustained responses to the violence in their communities, much of it against women and girls.
title: Indigenous people raise awareness about their missing and murdered

description: The central African nation of Rwanda is in discussions with President Donald Trump's administration on a possible deal to accept deported migrants from the United States, the country's foreign minister said late Sunday.
title: Rwanda in talks with Washington on accepting deported migrants from the U.S., minister says

description: People with celiac disease can kiss without fear, even if their partner has just eaten gluten, according to a new study.
title: Can you kiss someone who just ate gluten if you have celiac disease? A study says yes

description: Around nine people were shot when multiple shooters opened fire Sunday night in Glendale, Arizona, police said.
title: Up to 9 people shot at a restaurant in Glendale, Arizona, police say

description: BOSTON — Former Vice President Mike Pence on Sunday repeatedly invoked the Constitution and said it is what “binds us all together” after receiving the John F. Kennedy Profile in Courage Award.
title: Mike Pence receives JFK Profile in Courage Award for Jan. 6 actions

description: President Donald Trump on Sunday said he will direct several federal agencies to "reopen a substantially enlarged and rebuilt Alcatraz," a facility that for decades served as a federal prison and is now a national park.
title: Trump says he will reopen 'enlarged and rebuilt' Alcatraz prison

description: Philadelphia police are investigating and a Temple University student has been suspended following an antisemitic incident at the Barstool Sports bar in the city Saturday night.
title: Philadelphia police investigate antisemitic incident at Barstool bar

description: WASHINGTON — President Donald Trump is expected to announce Monday an agreement for Washington, D.C., to host the 2027 NFL draft, a person familiar with the plans told NBC News.
title: Trump set to announce the 2027 NFL draft will be in Washington — possibly on the National Mall

description: President Donald Trump announced plans Sunday to implement a 100% tariff on movies made in other countries that are imported to the United States, decrying other nations for offering financial incentives meant to “draw our filmmakers and studios away from the United States.”
title: Trump announces plans for 100% tariffs on all foreign movies

description: A Guatemalan woman who gave birth to an American baby less than a week ago is being held along with her newborn as she faces deportation, U.S. officials said.
title: Newborn U.S. citizen and Guatemalan mom detained as she faces deportation
